author: Aamir Salati | India.com Sports Desk
title: Virender Sehwag officially announces retirement for international cricket & IPL
text:
Virender Sehwag officially announces retirement for international cricket & IPL By India.com Sports Desk on October 20, 2015 at 3:35 PM Comments Indian Cricketer Virender Sehwag has officially announced his retirement from all forms of international cricket and Indian Premier League (IPL) as well. Sehwag took to twitter to announce his decision. Interestingly, Sehwag is celebrating his 37th birthday today. Also Read- Virender Sehwag special: 6 records held by Nawab of Najafgarh On Monday night, Sehwag during a press conference in Dubai had announced that once he reaches India he will decided after that whether to retire or not. And his announcement regarding his retirement was on cards. Sehwag, who last represented India in a Test match against Australia in 2013, has featured in 104 Tests and 251 One-Day Internationals (ODI). The swashbuckling opener, who has scored 8586 Test runs, remains the only triple centurion for India in Test matches. I hereby retire from all forms of international cricket and from the Indian Premier League. A statement will follow. 
— Virender Sehwag (@virendersehwag) October 20, 2015 He has scored 8273 runs in ODIs and averaged just over 35. Sehwag was known for fearless approach at top of the innings and he continued his aggression in game’s longest format as well. Sehwag made his ODI debut against Pakistan at Mohali in 1999 and two years later was drafted in Test side against South Africa. The right-hander was instrumental in India successful World Cup campaign in 2011 and scored 380 runs, averaging 47.50. However, due to his poor form he was not considered for World Cup earlier this year in Australia and New Zealand.
